[31/05/18, 7:02:29 PM] Akash (pushstart): Good Evening Members! 
You all are hereby informed that the group pertains only to getting your requirements fulfilled. We are trying our level best to make it a place where all your requirements are met and we will be more thn happy if this group comes into your mind whenever you have any requirement. 
To make sure we retain good and happening members of the community, who are a very rich resource for us, we have made certain rules that are mentioned in the group picture. 

Adding to it, please follow two things more: 
1) The one who is posting a requirement also add contact details with your post on this group. This may help us get your requirements fulfilled from other PushGroups as well. 

2) All those who are helping community members in fulfillment of the requirements, please try to do it in personal message. As due to so many messages, the main messages go somewhere too above that they do not sometimes reach the right person. The main motive is to reduce chatting on this group. 

PushThanks
PushRegards

[04/06/18, 2:10:25 PM] â€ª+91Â 98888Â 69616â€¬: Is pushevent a diff platform just inquiring.
[04/06/18, 2:15:25 PM] Prathmesh Baheti (pushstart): Well, its a different fb group where in people can share events and everything related.. when initially we started at pushstart group, event posting started growing.. now its good to be aware but as u might have seen with a lot of other startup groups, it ultimately ends up being a link dumping or promotional event sharing.. soo pushevents was created for 2 reasons. 1. To safeguard the interests of pushstarters and not spam their walls with events instead be true and share knowledge & 2. To actually share interesting events near you where in you would want to know more about, connect or attend with fellow pushstarters. 

Thanks to the good community folks, we have been able to do both 1 and 2 to some extents

*Who should apply for a FastTrack?* 
Startupbootcamp FastTrack sessions are open for all startups. If you are looking for targeted advice from leading Smart City experts, this is the place for you!

We are especially looking for startups in:
_IoT and Connectivity_
_Urban automation and Smart Transportation_
_Open City Data_
_Sustainable Cities and Living_
_Smart Government_
_Smart Retail_
_Artificial Intelligence_
_Blockchain_

*Why apply for a FastTrack?* 
Startups joining the FastTrack will receive immediate feedback from experienced entrepreneurs, investors, and industry experts, expand your network meeting other startup founders, and meet the Startupbootcamp Smart City team.

*How to apply for a FastTrack?* 
Simply complete the short online form to apply for the FastTrack to be held in
New Delhi - July 2
Bangalore - July 4
Mumbai - July 6

Applications close 6 days before the event, so make sure you complete your application by then!

We will be in touch shortly after applications close to notify applicants that have been selected to join. If you have any questions about FastTracks or the accelerator program, feel free to drop us a line at info@startupfellowship.orgâ â â â 


Startupbootcamp Smart City Dubai's intensive *3+3 month program provides 10 selected Smart City companies with hands-on mentorship from over 100 industry experts, office space in Dubai, seed funding, and access to a global network of investors and corporate partners* from across the Smart City industry.

Dubai Silicon Oasis Authority in collaboration with du, Dubai Chamber, Smart Dubai, Visa, Orange Business Services, and RIT New York have joined to fund the Dubai Smart City Consortium. These key partners provide expertise, exposure channels, APIs and unparalleled access to their deep Smart City network of industry professionals from around the world.

[22/06/18, 5:23:40 PM] Harshal (Pushstart): Hello guys Harshal Shroff here, After running and exiting my operations of 18 outlets and retaining the brand of This Corn,I visited my home town(Chinchani in Palaghar district) after 8yrs of living in Mumbai, I see that not much has changed here apart from the fact that people consume more data(Due to JIO and the current data based marketing) on their phone and are slowly getting aware about "The power of internet and connected lives" it's more like electricity, which still has power cuts in many rural areas. It's been a overwhelming experience of starting up once and humbling to exit and start once again.

However, Schools and bussiness dont see the value of data connections, and even if they do.. complete connectivity becomes an issue due to unstable Network performance.

In the comming one month i am LOOKING to connect and speak with people interested to build multilingual and affordable ways to bring 4G/5G broadband and connect applications to Rural India with "wireless street level WIFI connectivity, based on renewable POWER solutions to effective ways to deliver digital access to people with incomes less than 10k/month

-Robust cheap wireless street level connectivity infrastructure
-Delivering NEW experiences and products to Rural India in affordable ways

[24/06/18, 7:31:40 PM] â€ª+91Â 99909Â 66887â€¬: http://www.thehindu.com/business/cas-excluded-from-fair-valuation-of-start-ups/article24007644.ece
[24/06/18, 7:32:23 PM] â€ª+91Â 99909Â 66887â€¬: Can someone explain, what will be the effect of this new rule ?
[24/06/18, 8:56:59 PM] Utkarsh Bangalore (pushstart): Yea
[24/06/18, 8:57:17 PM] Utkarsh Bangalore (pushstart): Guys, I think this is important.
[24/06/18, 8:59:21 PM] Utkarsh Bangalore (pushstart): Every time your company needs a valutation (mostly while raising funds), a CA issues a valuation certificate which is then provided to the IT department.
This is what was happening till now.
But, according to this rule, for someone to issue a valuation certificate, a CA certification is not enough.
You need to be a merchant banker.
[24/06/18, 9:18:18 PM] â€ª+91Â 99909Â 66887â€¬: But then in this case the fee will be higher and also valuation will be what a merchant banker will decide, if there is an agreement between me and my investor whatever value we decide, but now we will be not allow to do that, because of this rule, and it be the end startup ecosystem in India, because everyone is not Ambani, adani who can run company on his own, or have assets and contacts in bank to get huge loans.
[24/06/18, 9:22:41 PM] â€ª+91Â 99909Â 66887â€¬: What if I register my company offshore like Singapore then these idiotic rules no longer apply, thats what flipkart did ğŸ¤£
[24/06/18, 10:01:30 PM] Nikhil Sacheva (ps): They did after they got initial round of funding and they were doing well. Its not feasible for a budding startup to bear offshore costs

[26/06/18, 11:56:13 AM] Bits Spark: Hey, a general suggestion 

If you're looking for a connect (especially with someone difficult to reach) please be specific about your reason and the context. 

If you cannot be bothered to write down why and what you want, why should anyone on the community take out the time to connect you and ask someone for their time? 

This is more important with people who are difficult to reach, but should be extended as a general courtesy.

[30/06/18, 9:51:53 AM] Neeraj Joshi: [Long Read] - Invite for Social Samosa's LIVE Conference

The team at Social Samosa is excited to pay a tribute to the medium which is a driving factor for the evolution, existence and sustenance of quite a lot of Brands, Agencies, Publishers, Platforms, and Creators!

When we set out to recreate the #SMLive Magic this year, I was told 8 Million People and 2 Lac+ Video Views were possible in 2017 and it's a tough nut to crack considering the friendly NewsFeed algorithm.

As ambitious as it may sound, riding high in the faith and power of our community of Marketers, Agency Professionals, Creators, and Practitioner we are all set to take the challenge and breach the circles of virality with #SMLive2018

We plan to kick-start the day with a Keynote Address from one of the pioneers in Indian Advertising and Marketing Industry - Mr. Ashish Bhasin

Taking the baton from him C-Suite Advisor and Power Influencer - Tanvi Gautam will take us through the essentials of Building an Authentic Personal Brand on Social Media

Anoushka Adya, Rashi Ray and Mounica Tata DoodleODrama will discuss on how Social Media has emerged as a great tool to enable Women Empowerment

This is just the beginning; next up we have Kainaz Karmakar  and Harshad Rajadhyaksha from the team which managed to win Ogilvy India's first CANNES Grand Prix for Creative Effectiveness this year with Savlon Healthy Hands Chalk Sticks. They will speak about the LITTLE they know about Great Advertising!

A lot has been spoken about the various applications of Data across, Ashish Tiwari will share a different perspective on Data-Driven Storytelling to craft the right message

Chandramohan Mehra from Bajaj Allianz Life Insurance will bring in the flavor of Hyper Current and Topical Content with anecdotes from their collaboration with Dabbu The Dancer aka The Dancing Uncle

Threading thoughts from being responsive and customer-centric at all points in time, Vineet Singh will share Quick Social CRM Hacks to win over audiences

Mr. Bean from the Indian Digital Industry, Nitin Bhatia will enunciate the importance and relevance of Data in the value chain

Shifting Gear towards some Creator Tales, Ranveer Allahbadia - The Beer Biceps will share his story on carving a niche amongst the content clutter

The Master Storyteller behind some of the most engaging original content from Kingfisher, Sandeep Balan will draw parallels between Branded Content and Original Content

Over the past few years, Wittyfeed has become one of the largest Viral Content Companies and Parveen Singhal will share Growth Hacking Lessons in the process of building this new age company

Nidhi Bisht and Sarjita Jain from India's Leading Women Content Channel will sum up the #SMLive2018 show with a talk on Creating Entertainment for Women with Brands

That's the amazing lineup we have been talking about ever since we launched the initiative this year; as we strive to raise the bar and make this BIGGER & BETTER we are counting on your support to make this happen!

Come and join us to Celebrate #WorldSocialMedia Day

- Show Interest/Attendance to the event here bit.ly/SMLive2018

- Engage with our esteemed speakers who are sparing out time on a Saturday for this cause

- Share your favorite sessions within the network and shower some love using #SMLive2018

Here's wishing you all a very Happy #WorldSocialMedia Day!

Cheers!
Hitesh & Team Social Samosa

[26/07/18, 4:40:52 PM] Neeraj Joshi: #PushUpdate #PushAMA #PushLaunch 
Our first Product Launch+AMA on Pushstart by founder of Wild Earth. 

Ask her anything and everything related to her journey and brand Wild Earth <3 <3 

Shabia Ravi Walia, Founder and Owner of 'Wild Earth' is a media professional for the past 24 years.ï»¿Â 

'Wild Earth' was born out of Shabia's fears of what she put on her baby's body after she became a mother. 

The labels scared her and the fact that she did not understand what went into the products made her uncomfortable. 

Being the solution driven person she is, Shabia started making soaps and lotions in her own kitchen.Â  

Soon word spread and mothers were demanding her to make the full range. Her experiments proved to be a huge hit with everyone and soon she was forced to move from her kitchen to a proper office and workshop

Today Shabia is proud to have created a brand that provides natural quality products which young, old and babies can use without any fear of side effects of harsh chemicals.

'Wild Earth' today sells online, thru retail stores, is a huge gifting opting for corporates and is exported to quite a few foreign countries, purely on the basis of its quality and the pure intention behind the brand, an intention that was born from a mothers heart and not in a business school.

https://www.facebook.com/groups/Pushstarter/permalink/1840011552726123/

[09/08/18, 10:34:11 AM] Ashutosh Kumar (pushstart): Ministry of Corporate Affairs has notified the amended Section 42 and its corresponding Rule No. 14 of the Companies Act, 2013 with effect from August 07, 2018. 

 
Please find herewith the broad changes made in the revised section 42 and its corresponding rules:

(a) Deletion of requirement w.r.t. value of offer or invitation per person: The requirement of the value of offer or invitation per person of INR 20,000/- of face value of the securities has been done away with.

(b) Usage of Share Application Money: Now a company is not permitted to utilize the share application money received by it unless (i) allotment is made; and (ii) the return of allotment, in e-form PAS â€“ 3, is filed with the Registrar of Companies.

(c) Reduction in time period for filing e-form PAS â€“ 3: Now, a company is required to file the return of allotment within 15 days of allotment instead of 30 days.

(d) Separate penal provisions for non-filing of e-form PAS â€“ 3:  Where a company defaults in filing e-form PAS â€“ 3 within 15 days of allotment, the company, its promoters and directors shall be liable with a penalty INR 1,000/- per day but not exceeding INR 25,00,000/-.

(e) Common private placement offer cum application form: The form PAS-4 has been revised and has a small section of application letter that needs to be filed in by the applicant. This application needs to be submitted by the applicant along with subscription money paid either by cheque, demand draft or other banking channel and not by cash.

(f) Fresh offer prior to allotment: Earlier there was a restriction that no fresh offer or invitation can be made unless the allotment w.r.t. any earlier offer has been completed or the offer has been withdrawn or abandoned. Now a carve out has been provided that where he number of persons to whom the offer is made does not exceed 200, the company may, at any time, make more than one issue of securities to such class of identified persons.

 (g) Restriction on rights of renunciation: The revised section specifically restricts any right of renunciation of the private placement offer that is been made by the issuer company. The earlier section and rules did not have the said restriction.

 (h) Revision of penalty amount: The penal provision has been revised from â€˜the amount involved in the offer or invitation or Rupees Two Crore, whichever is higherâ€ to â€˜the amount involved in the offer or invitation or Rupees Two Crore, whichever is lowerâ€.

Please find herewith the links to the commencement notification and the revised rules:

www.mca.gov.in/Ministry/pdf/CommencementNoti07_08082018.pdf

www.mca.gov.in/Ministry/pdf/RuleProspectusSecurities07_08082018.pdf

More updates at https://facebook.com/groups/198563060203483/

[17/08/18, 10:00:42 PM] Priyanka Deo (ps): If interested or know anyone interested in speaking- here are the prompts:
[17/08/18, 10:01:12 PM] Priyanka Deo (ps): Speaker Prompt
There are several ways to go about it. Your 4-7 minute monologue must have personal insights and also tie in your story as an entrepreneur/professional/student in India. 

We will have a small intro which I will compile & finalize with you tomorrow. This intro will be read right before you speak, so you don't need to include this in your 4-7 minutes.

Remember, it is open mic which is way more casual than a formal speech- so have fun with it! The people want to know about you and your story :)  

Write your monologue around the following topics: 

1. Just a few years ago, being an entrepreneur was a term that was not something to be proud of in India. Now the term is lauded. How has this helped you evolve as an entrepreneur? 
2. How do you handle your personal/professional life? What is the hardest part and how do you deal with it?
3. Many government efforts now push for entrepreneurship which carry the mantra, 'why take jobs when you can create jobs?' How do you fit into this energy? 
4. What is the biggest struggle you have faced in your professional life and how have you overcome it? 
5. Now, there are many efforts that India is making to finance and support entrepreneurs. How have you leveraged that with your company?
[17/08/18, 10:01:40 PM] Priyanka Deo (ps): 6. What is the biggest struggle you have faced as a female entrepreneur/professional? How have you overcome it?

[17/08/18, 11:05:01 PM] Ridhima (ps): Kerala is being ravaged by unprecedented torrential rains leading to an extremely grave situation of flood spread across 14 districts. More than 2 lakh people have been displaced with a death-toll of 324. Doctors in the state have already started working double-shifts. As per WHO, the aftermath of floods usually see an increase in water-borne and vector-borne diseases. An estimated 4 lakh patients would require medical consultations in the next few weeks. To assist with this exponential demand, we are planning to set up a basic website where patients can seek free medical advice. For this, we are looking for the following who can give time pro-bono : 1) Qualified doctors, 2) Volunteers who speak Malayalam, 3) Developers who can help set up the technology.

â€[25/08/18, 2:02:38 PM] Aditya Raja (pushstart): â€video omitted
[25/08/18, 2:02:42 PM] Aditya Raja (pushstart): Life is at an halt in the state of Kerala, due to heavy rainfall and opening of almost 35 dams. According to the Government records, 324 deaths and 223139 people have gone homeless and admitted in 1500+ relief camps. Sources say that Kerala is facing its worst floods in 100 years. 

Where will these people go? 

The students of Chinmaya Vishwavidyapeeth, have come up with an initiative in order to provide them with the basic means to live including food, clothing, shelter and rehabilitation.
The major goal of this initiative is to support those people who are affected by the floods, in whatever way possible. As we are in the affected areas (Ernakulam, Kerala) , we are able to feel the necessity for a plan of action or an initiative to help and serve our people. 
We have started an online campaign in order to raise fund --

https://www.bitgiving.com/savekeralasavepeople

And, we have raised almost 8.2 Lakh in 4 days. Almost, 132 families were provided with basic requirements for their meal and stay. Groceries, utensils, medicines, toiletries and 2 sets of dress including undergarments, Sanitary Napkins. 
Recently, when we visited the relief camps, we found the scale of huge destruction: houses have turned into piled bricks, roads are broken, mud is there everywhere. It has been noticed that there has been a stark increase in the number of air and vector-borne diseases. 
For instance, in a camp in Arakkunam, there were 16 pregnant ladies who were stranded without proper food, care and nursing. After three days, they got the doctor after a series of rejection by multiple doctors.
This made us ask the question: What can we do to help the homeless pregnant ladies and Keralites at large? Is 8 lakh enough to serve the people around us? 

The blunt answer is NO. 

It isn't enough. It Isn't enough to even help one family cover their rehabilitation.
Hence, we are asking for more funds. To make the process transparent, we will have a sheet where we calculate each and every expense we incur. 

Service before self is our motto. Humanity our religion.
Please support Kerala. Rebuild Kerala.

[31/08/18, 12:47:18 PM] â€ª+91Â 83760Â 83676â€¬: 1. Cheap, most courses are like $10.

3. One time payment. Most websites charge on recurring basis. 

4. Refund policy. If I accidentally purchase wrong course or I Dont like the course, they refund immediately. 

5. Hugeee variety of courses. From coding to designing to improving speaking skills.

[31/08/18, 10:18:25 PM] Gitanjali (ps): Looking for advice. How important is a product manager/UI expert for a startup to be taken in exchange of equity. 
How to think about it? How much equity to give? Any inputs to clarify this situation will be of great help.
[31/08/18, 10:19:56 PM] Neeraj Kumar (ps): It totally depends upon the type of business model and work
[31/08/18, 10:21:18 PM] Neeraj Kumar (ps): Like if its a software product (not that complex) for which resources are easily available then will suggest you to hire people and don't dissolve equity
[31/08/18, 10:23:24 PM] Neeraj Kumar (ps): Further if the development is complex and the cost for product dev. is too high (needs continous upgrades) then you can think for long term partner with equity sharing, who can take care of the tech side!
[31/08/18, 10:26:02 PM] Neeraj Kumar (ps): Talking about how much equity?
Then it also depends at which stage the startup is like if its idea phase or in early phase then you can go upto 50% (in case 2 partners only) otherwise if startup has already made a name in market then you can negotiate accordingly
[31/08/18, 10:26:31 PM] Ashutosh Vyas (pushstart): Product manager and UI expert can't be used with a /
They r teo different roles. If it's a tech product you definitely would need a product mgr for longer term. Might outsource or hire the UI  guy
[31/08/18, 10:29:13 PM] Vasishta Cary (pushstart): Exactly
[31/08/18, 10:53:11 PM] â€ª+91Â 96324Â 44388â€¬: Gitanjali,  you are mixing 2 different things.  If your core business is driven by the tech product then you need someone who is domain experts n capable enough to drive your product roadmap to meet the business outcomes. In your case he/she can be name as product manager. 
Now the second thing is compensation or value of his/her time in return. That you need to decide based on the individual how you can keep him/her motivated to go extra miles to achieve the business goals. So,  tech driven businesses go with equity option as its   strategically (kind of marriage contract)  fits to them.
[31/08/18, 10:57:46 PM] Utkarsh Bangalore (pushstart): It very much depends on your product.
One of my friends here in Bangalore made his place as a product manager in a company after a couple of meetings, worked on the product and the company gave him Esops later.
Are we speaking of something like this?
[31/08/18, 11:15:07 PM] PG: I can help with this
[31/08/18, 11:15:21 PM] PG: As in I can connect
[31/08/18, 11:34:56 PM] Pulkit Bhatia (ps): Thnx.sent 
you a PM
[01/09/18, 1:59:22 AM] Kumar Mayank (pushstart): I feel PM/UI expert are both over-rated. You have to be both when you start your own. And don't get me wrong, I was a PM myself.. but in startup world it is just customer feedback that you weave back in your product. Hand out a solid equity (10%-49%) to a senior 'full-stack developer' and get your product developed to the market fit.
[01/09/18, 2:22:29 AM] Vaibhav Nanda (pushstart): Lol I would disagree here, PM and UI are one of the most important parts of a team, it's plus point when your UI UX guy knows PM, and it happens alot of time!
When you are building a saas people will use your platform over  mine bcz your is easy to use and solves same problem.
Your developer will make a jugad UI that won't end look good, and I run an agency too and I fight with my devs because they do and they will fuck up UI, there is a learning process where your full stack developer becomes a design centric FSD.
[01/09/18, 2:22:59 AM] Vaibhav Nanda (pushstart): Even look*
[01/09/18, 10:01:20 AM] Gitanjali (ps): Woah! Interesting and conflicting opinions. My confusion deepens further. Esops is a good idea. I need tp explore that more. 
Mine is not tech heavy. It is a B2C platform in health education
[01/09/18, 10:19:17 AM] Vasishta Cary (pushstart): Let me jump in here now, I have been reading all messages, PM is a good role in a company trying to scale up, they have an understanding of how product works and what a product is all about but then in a startup founders play the role well and manage the team and development efforts, UI/UX freelancer helps a lot, especially in a B2C product as devs are not design experts, I have seen loads of start-ups fail at this point, never compromise on the design part. What you essentially need is a product designer, someone who can design the product in terms of customer value proposition, user flow, innovative design, UI/UX, architecture etc. That is the kind of person who is a strong team member you need.
[01/09/18, 10:20:08 AM] Vasishta Cary (pushstart): Esops is a grey area in india, often bending towards illegal. Don't offer equity as it's never gonna help
[01/09/18, 10:20:24 AM] Vasishta Cary (pushstart): Rather hire them on a hourly consultation basis
[01/09/18, 10:20:40 AM] Gitanjali (ps): Hmm
[01/09/18, 10:21:27 AM] Gitanjali (ps): Why equity won't help? Can you pls explain the challenges. So that i know better when negotiating
[01/09/18, 10:25:00 AM] Arbab (pushstart): Not to forget each and every succesful or unicorn have great Product and UI as well
[01/09/18, 10:25:31 AM] Ashutosh Vyas (pushstart): You can have a Product Manager on equity basis and let him handle the UI/UX guy (outsourced or hired) while you take care of the business side of it.
[01/09/18, 10:26:23 AM] Vasishta Cary (pushstart): Cos there has to be a value of the company and growth projections so that you can match the opportunity cost keeping long term need in mind. 

Let's say they charge 50k a month, that comes to 6L a year, you will have o give equity worth that amount, now let's say they grow and increase the charges by 20% a year, will value of equity also grow ? And what if the equity grows more than that ? Also what if you don't want the association any more ? What if they don't want to associate any more ? If they have equity, they are a director, what other powers do they have ? Are they a risk to you in future ?
[01/09/18, 10:26:37 AM] Vasishta Cary (pushstart): This will help
[01/09/18, 10:45:58 AM] Prathmesh Baheti (pushstart): Id like to weigh in on this, esops are not grey, they are slightly underused. With the ipos coming in indian markets every other week, id be surprised if ppl are start discounting esops. Theres huge difference between an esop vs hourly consultation
[01/09/18, 10:45:59 AM] Prathmesh Baheti (pushstart): An esop keeps a person invested in tje company for a little long term where buying into the future and vision of the company becomes a consideration. Hourly consultation is friends with benefits to put it mildly.
[01/09/18, 10:46:56 AM] Prathmesh Baheti (pushstart): So this is also something which cant be shelled out to just about anyone and everyone!
[01/09/18, 10:47:23 AM] Vasishta Cary (pushstart): I am not saying they are the same thing or anything but then sometimes you want a FWB not a marriage, keeps it easy to manage
[01/09/18, 10:47:52 AM] Prathmesh Baheti (pushstart): Exactly, thats a choice both parties make!
[01/09/18, 10:48:54 AM] Vasishta Cary (pushstart): Secondly cash is always a better incentive than future equity
[01/09/18, 10:51:08 AM] Aditya Raja (pushstart): Cannot imagine this coming from you sirjiğŸ˜
[01/09/18, 10:52:12 AM] Vasishta Cary (pushstart): Not for me but it is for most people
[01/09/18, 10:52:34 AM] Vasishta Cary (pushstart): You can hire faster with cash than esops
[01/09/18, 10:58:30 AM] Gitanjali (ps): So this guy had connected with me a year back. Charged a high amount for being hired which I couldn't afford. Now, he comes back with this offer of equity and says he loves my startup idea etc. 
Just to put context to thus discussion.
[01/09/18, 11:02:26 AM] Vasishta Cary (pushstart): DM me ? maybe i can add some more insights
[01/09/18, 11:04:58 AM] Gitanjali (ps): Ok
[01/09/18, 11:40:10 AM] â€ª+91Â 96324Â 44388â€¬: Lots of people approach like this. Have a strong evaluation process to see if one fits to carry  the vision of your product/organisation. Team is a strong factor in making any business idea successful. DM me if you are looking for any help.
[01/09/18, 11:52:42 AM] Bits Spark: More 2 cents. 

At an early stage start up, you have 2 kinds of people. 
People who sell stuff
People who build the stuff that you sell (a PM does not build btw, if you're the non tech founder then mktg, product, sales etc if your responsibility. Don't get a new person to do 'product'. 

Unless this person is one of these (and you are the other type) don't waste your breath.
[01/09/18, 11:59:46 AM] Bits Spark: Equity number, depending upon where you are (these are rough guidelines)
1) No product market fit/validation, divide equity equally amongst all
2) No funding but validation/pilot done, double digits equity expected
3) Pre-seed round raised, 4-10%
4) Seed round raised, can still give out common stock (with vesting) but 1-2% (there is a particular way to structure it). Usually give esops. 
5) Series A onwards, esops only
[01/09/18, 12:17:33 PM] Kumar Mayank (pushstart): Thanks for this. Some learning for me too.

[11/09/18, 12:49:44 PM] Atul Goyal (ps): can raise funds? yes. from whom? probably loan from banks and not VCs. contrary to what many said VCs aren't looking for low risk. what they're looking for is a huge opportunity though. chances of that happening in traditional biz is less so VCs usually won't even talk to you unless you can show a huge market. and if it's a traditional biz with potential margin, getting a debt/loan could be even better idea given you retain whole ownership and full control?
[11/09/18, 1:05:45 PM] Nveen (ps): I agree unless the business is unique traditional businesses have a better chance of getting a loan. There are a lot of FinTech companies that give out loans with low interest rates. Unless the idea is disruptive kinda like Wow momos itâ€™s not a viable investment. Again I am not an investor but I am sure maybe some do invest to keep the cash flow going.
[11/09/18, 1:09:54 PM] Bits Spark: Some perspective: 
VCs, Banks, PEs, IBs, Angels, Family offices, pension funds etc are all basically money lenders. 
They are just different in terms of their risk appetite and the consequent payoffs. 

So, a traditional business, with steady cash flows has very limited requirement for equity capital (thats what a VC investment is). Debt capital is significantly cheaper. 

In fact, (after 4 years in the Angel investment business), I have advised many folks looking to start up (build a business) to just get a bank loan. That's how most businesses were built and still are. For eg, while cult.fit had raised their initial round as an equity round (~15mn) they have currently raised a very large debt round.

An analogy all types of funding are basically vehicles with specific characteristics. You wouldn't use a sports car to transport heavy machinery, the same way you won't buy a mini truck to get from the metro to your house. They will all get things from point A to B, albeit in a different manner/for a diff use case.
[11/09/18, 1:11:25 PM] Bits Spark: VC funding is a very specific use case of capital deployment and a really really expensive one
[11/09/18, 1:17:51 PM] â€ª+91Â 96546Â 46688â€¬: Could not have asked for a better prespective
[11/09/18, 2:06:36 PM] â€ª+91Â 99785Â 38243â€¬: Any contact for a Process Manager in GGN?

Key Responsibilities

Prepare training agenda, timelines and content flow as necessary to deliver effective training
Developing and updating Training content & SOPs preparation as per Process requirement

Ability to execute training tasks/ assignment on short notice
Work closely with the operation teams to improve process

[19/09/18, 2:51:57 PM] Vasishta Cary (pushstart): Black Box Testing : This involves deep and through user testing of the product, following guidelines of user testing and filling a survey form at the end along with commentary. 

Scope of testing : this is not a bug hunt but a test to understand and chart a baseline of user flow, you will be given a control set and user guidelines and you have to go through the entire website, use it and try as many things as possible within the guideline and fill the feedback survey there after

 Remuneration : You will have to do this activity 2 times, and you will receive a amazon gift card once you complete it along with a surprise gift if we really love the feedback and test. 

Please Fill the form to get a chance to be part of the black box testing group 
https://goo.gl/forms/KtnAtRG9eVYb9L102

Hello Pushstarters, 
We recently Launched #PushContributor of the Week! ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥
ï¿¼
What is #PushContributors of the Week? 
Every week on Sunday @ 11pm, we will recognize the TOP 5 Pushstarters who have contributed the MOST in the community!

(A NEWER version of #PushMessiahs)

What will I get by becoming #PushContributor of the Week?  ğŸ¤”ğŸ¤”
*Recognition as #PushContributor of the Week in your specific Domain! 
*We will share about your contribution across our FB, Whatsapp and LinkedIn channels: 20K+ Reach. 
*You will get a Personalised Online Badge of â€œ#PushContributor of the Weekâ€. 
*You will be given Priority while selecting a host for #PushQnA: 3k+ Reach. 
*You will get priority while scheduling #PushLaunch: 3k+ Reach
*You will get an Opportunity to work with Pushstart and Grow any one of Pushstartâ€™s initiative (if interested).

In short, we will help you with BUILDING your BRAND and NETWORK! ğŸ˜ğŸ˜

How can I become a #PushContributor of the Week? 
By CONTRIBUTING MORE on Pushstart. 

You can CONTRIBUTE on Pushstart in the following 3 ways: 
*Share your knowledge and learnings either by Sharing Relevant Links or by Creating a post directly on Pushstart. 
(Remember to put a #PushKnowledge tag. Will help us in tracking the contribution) 
*Answer Questions asked by Pushstarters (#AskPS posts). 
*Give relevant Feedback whenever a someone launches their Startup (#PushLaunch posts). 

Where to Contribute? 
On Pushstart FB Channel: bit.ly/Pushstartfbchannel

Attaching the pic of top 5 #PushContributors from previous week here! â¤ â¤

[01/11/18, 4:44:21 PM] Akash (pushstart): To all wonderful PushFamily Members from Delhi and NCR. 

How many of you are able to relate your journey with any point below:
1) Many Startup Founders, especially who are core techie, have built amazing products but are not able to Sell it due to undefined Sales Process. 
2) Recruiting & Managing Sales Team is a big challange with most of the startups. 
3) Nearly 60% of sales leaders ranked sales conversations as the most important factor in creating competitive differentiation. (And you also believe the same)
4) Most of us wish to get rid of wasting time on prospects and face difficulty in finding qualified leads. 
5) Challenges faced while doing sales demotivate us and even sometimes make us doubt our products. 

We at Groomers are starting our Nano Degree Program on Sales Management with Year Long Assistance from Domain Relevant Industry Experts. This educational course is specifically designed keeping in mind the above points.

A full time person, might not be even working full time, at times even couple of hours is more effective compared to entire day.

[13/11/18, 8:57:04 PM] Nikhil Sharma (nasscom): Dear All,
 
Start-ups today are amongst the most critical pillars of the Indian IT industry representing a huge opportunity for India to retain its competitive advantage. Over the past few years, start-ups have contributed to the industry by building new innovative products and services. Therefore an understanding of laws and procedures for the protection of such innovations is utmost important and necessary for the growth of their businesses. While the Industry leaders are aware of the importance of IP and are filing patents nationally as well as in other jurisdictions however not much IP filings is seen by small medium IT enterprises including technology startups.
 
In this backdrop, NASSCOM in association with K&S partners is organizing an interactive session to create awareness about the patent system and steps that are needed to protect innovations in India and other key jurisdictions like UK/EU on 16th November 2018 at NASSCOM 10,000 Startups Warehouse, Hartron Innovation Campus, Gurugram, as per the below schedule.
 
Agenda
 
2:00 pm -  2:30 pm -  Registration
2:30 pm - 2:35 pm -   Welcome by NASSCOM
2:35 pm - 3:20 pm -   Presentation by Mr. David Slattery, Partner , Wilson & Gunn (Profile: https://www.wilsongunn.com/who-we-are/our-people/david-slattery
3:20 pm - 4:00 pm -   Presentation by Mr.S K Srihari, Partner, K&S Partners
4:00 pm - 4:30 pm â€“   Q&A
4:30 pm onwards   -   Networking Tea /Coffee
 
Venue
NASSCOM 10,000 Startups Warehouse, Hartron Innovation Campus, Gurugram
Events Room-1st Floor
 
It is our pleasure to invite all the startups to this interactive session on 16th November 2018 to understand the patent system in UK/EU & India and the benefits of route to protection.
 
We look forward to your kind confirmation!!

Regards
Nikhil Sharma
Nasscom

[21/11/18, 1:40:25 PM] Latika Wadhwa (momprecircle): Hi all, 

This is Latika Wadhwa- Founder of Mompreneur Circle ( a 5,00,000+ community of married women and mothers). 


Mompreneur Circle is an online network of communities with 5,00,000+ married women and mothers all over the country.

In the age of digitization the platform help women all over the country who are married or are mothers to get support and get solutions for issues related to their health, career, money, relationships, legal advises, kids etc.

Structure on which the Community Work:

1. Showcase/Advertise your work- The community act as a supportive platform for the married women entrepreneurs and mompreneurs to showcase/advertise their work/business. Whether you are home baker in Delhi, a Gynecologist in Mumbai or a Boutique Owner in Bangalore we help you connect to your prospective leads through making you advertise your business/services at nominal membership costs.

2. Get Instant Solutions for All your Problems through Live Helpline- For any kind of problem/ issues pertaining to health,money, kids, career, legal suggestions etc women can get instant solutions from fellow community members and industry experts who are onboard with us and the platform act as a live helpline of support when if you post a query at 2:00 am at night or at 6:00 AM in the morning you will get instant solutions.

3. Collaboration/Tieups with Brands- We partner with brands, collaborate with them, curate activities for them whose target audience is women or mothers and provide them an opportunity to connect and interact with our members about their brand offerings, brand ideologies and brand products/services.


Involve Yourself if you are a Brand:

1. Partner With Us- If you are having any event, workshop, meetup etc and want to partner with us you can connect over at connect@mompreneurcircle.com

2. Brand Activation Collaborations- We work closely with brands for brand activation and engagement collaborations and curate events ranging from blogger meets, brand centric workshops, contests, events etc.

3. Revenue Sharing Tieups- We also work on the revenue sharing structure with the brands.To Know more you can mail us at latika@mompreneurcircle.com

5. Customized Offerings with the Brands- We also curate customized offerings to the brands as per their need.

The community is a space that offers comfort, financial independence, give voice to all women thoughts without any judgement, help and to fulfill all your dreams and desire and Together we all can support each other.

Facebook Page- https://www.facebook.com/MompreneurCircle/

To connect- latika@mompreneurcircle.com

Thanks Neeraj for adding in such an amazing community of PushStarters

[24/11/18, 7:20:40 PM] Neeraj Joshi: Hello Pushstarters, 
Thanks a lot for the overwhelming response to our *Partnership* with *GMI* and *Forbes*  ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥

Hopefully, Many Pushstarters will be benefited out of it! â¤ â¤ 

After Launching about our Partnership, Many Pushstarters reached out to me with a lot of Genuine Doubts. 

*Kindly read through the following FAQ to get a better understanding of the Forbes Thingy:*  

*Whats GMI?* 
Great Manager Institute is a sister concern of Great Place to Work Inc - Headquartered in San-Francisco. 

It has offices in 54 countries works with 7000+ organizations and millions of employees every year.
 
*What is this partnership all about?*
GMI will be assessing YOU and your MANAGERS via a short survey sent to all your employees once you REGISTER.

Based on this data, TOP 100 Great People Managers and TOP 50 Organizations will be awarded and featured in Forbes India. â¤â¤

*Whats the Criteria for Qualification?* 
1) Any individual who has minimum 3 or more team members is eligible for individual recognition: TOP 100 Great People Managers. 

2) Any organization who has more than 50 employees and has operations in India for than 2 years is eligible for organizational recognition: TOP 50 Organizations. 

And both are not mutually exclusive, one individual can feature as well as his organization (if eligible) and vice versa. ;) ;) 

So all *Managers, Founders, Entrepreneurs with a minimum team size of 3 can APPLY*!                                                                           

*Where to Apply?*
Follow this link to apply: 
https://www.facebook.com/groups/Pushstarter/permalink/2018756481518295/

Feel free to Personally Msg me in case of any queries! 

Cheers!

[06/12/18, 12:17:29 PM] Arjun Singh Kalra (delhips): Seek previous available backup from GoDaddy, they may initially refuse saying you don't have backup service subscription, however keep firm and ask them you will pay for it. Generally they do give. Call up on their Indian customer care number
[06/12/18, 1:20:23 PM] Aayush (Pushstart): College fest
[06/12/18, 1:26:48 PM] PG: I did, they agreed but then they checked and there was no backup
[06/12/18, 1:33:01 PM] Arjun Singh Kalra (delhips): Keep pushing, keep talking to different support executives, that's normal of them to say initially they don't have, keep on offering that you will pay, raise it to next level of support. I did go through this sometime back and got the backup finally.
[06/12/18, 1:34:10 PM] Arjun Singh Kalra (delhips): It is a norm to have a backup for every host provider. What will happen if their servers crash and it's not your mistake, they do bring back all your data, no matter whatever hosting plan you are on.

[06/12/18, 3:30:36 PM] Ridhima (ps): Hi, the organization I work for - Young India Foundation, is hosting an informal meet up today. The details are as follows. Would be great to see you guys there. Thanks! 

Want to learn and discuss the current political landscape in India? Join YIF for an informal meetup in Gurugram as we discuss the political scenario, youth representation and much more in India.

Event link- https://bit.ly/2rjPt6V

*no registration required*

*What is YIF*
Young India Foundation is a nonprofit, non-partisan organisation recruiting young candidates in India and supporting them to stand for elections, starting with the Panchayat and the Municipality.

The foundation aims to empower India's young by helping people to run for local level positions as well as raise awareness on youth rights within India. The foundation works on solving India's gerontocracy by trying to make representation more accessible and inclusive to India's largest demographic.


Find more here- https://youngindia.foundation

The UK-India Fast Track Startup Fund will channelise capital investments to innovative tech startups and deepen the entrepreneurial connect between India & the UK. #GREATforCollaboration

Biggest Testing Hackathon in Town is here!

*The Test Tribe* Community is bringing its flagship Testing Hackathon *The Bug Feast* to Delhi after huge success in Mumbai and Bangalore.

The Bug Feast has 3 Startups participating by putting their Product under Test against *~100 Testers* under one roof for 4 straight hours. Yes, that's *400+ Testing hours*. 
Testing happens on multiple fronts like Functional, Security, Performance, Usability, etc. 

Our previous editions witnessed crazy number of Bugs logged between 700-1000 each. 

Companies like *Crowdfire, Junglee Games, Coviam, Runs, WandX, DocsApp* have participated in previous chapters and saw amazing results. You can participate as a Hiring Partner. Not only that, Testers from *50+ different companies* participated in previous editions. 

Grab this opportunity to get your product tested from the bests in the business. Remote participation is also possible. 

*Know more and register at-* bit.ly/tbfdelhi

[10/12/18, 9:51:26 PM] Bhavik (pushstart): Hi People,

Just to update you on the rules of the group.
[10/12/18, 9:51:29 PM] Bhavik (pushstart): *PushRules:* 
*Dos:* 
1. Start your Journey by Introducing yourself (hashtag: #PushIntro). 
*2. You can Seek Referral Connections:* (hashtag: #PushConnection)
2.1. Partner/Investor/Mentor/Consultant.   
2.2. Freelancer/Service Company. 
2.3. Any kind of Connection which helps you grow your Business. 
*3. You can Seek and Share Opportunities:* 
3.1. Job/Internship/Team. (Also share it on PushTalent channel on FB: https://www.facebook.com/groups/Pushtalent) 
3.2. Relevant Programs/Courses/Scholarships/Initiatives. 
3.3. Relevant Events/Meetups/Conferences (Only once in one week) 
3.4. Collab/Partnership opportunities. 
3.5  Seek Early adopters/Testers/Beta users. 
4. You can share about your Personal, Professional and Startup Achievements. 
5. Feel free to share if any kind of URGENT help is required. 
6. Initiate discussion for offline meetup.
[10/12/18, 9:51:39 PM] Bhavik (pushstart): *Donts:*
1. Cannot Message group members directly without their permission or referral. 
2. Post with same content cannot be shared more than once in a week.   
3. Any kind of post apart from the above-mentioned posts is not allowed. 
4. Idea Share/Startup Launch/Content Share/Problem Share: Direct to Pushstart main channel on FB: https://www.facebook.com/groups/Pushstarter/. 
5. Random images/videos/links/broadcasts/forwards NOT ALLOWED. 
6. Discussions around politics/sex/religion/love any other thing which might hurt other pushstarters is NOT ALLOWED. 
7. Any kind of marketing/promotional posts is NOT ALLOWED. 
8. Foul language/trying to disrupt the culture/obscene pics: Straightaway Blocked.  

*First Two times WARNING and Third time REMOVAL for any of the DONTS.*

[13/12/18, 11:43:20 AM] Ashutosh Kumar (pushstart): Based on my interaction with thousands of Startup founders and wannapreneurs, I recommend these goal setting and visioning questions that will help you reÂ­imagine success however you define it.

Q1: Describe what you want the business to be like one year from now. How much time will you spend working? How much money will you make? Which tasks will you delegate, and which will you do yourself? What kind of projects will you work on? Paint a clear picture with the most accurate description you can.

Q2: What were your biggest challenges last year and how did you address them? What systems, procedures or practices can you put into place so that these challenges don't recur in the coming year?

Q3: Which people or organizations have the tools, expertise or resources that will be beneficial to your work? How can you form a relationship with these people or organizations?

Q4: What are your biggest business strengths, and how did you develop them over the past year? How can you continue to leverage and develop them over the coming year?

Q5: What is a large goal that you have that scares you, but you know the potential rewards are great? What can you do this year to work towards that goal and overcome your fear or hesitation?

Q6: What are the low value tasks that take an inordinate amount of your time? Can these be outsourced or delegated?

Q7: And lastly, what one goal would you pursue this year if you know you could not fail?

Not everyone has the time or the opportunity to be a good mentor, and convincing someone to put their time and energy into being yours takes more than just a quick email. Landing a great mentor means you have to choose the person you ask carefully, ask them the right way, and then know when to follow up (and when not to follow up, for that matter.)

Choosing the right person as a mentor is probably the biggest factor to whether they'll accept your request. Most people want mentors who exemplify their vision of successâ€”business leaders, entrepreneurs, recognizable namesâ€”it's easy to want to have a famous businessperson, developer, or activist as your personal mentor. Odds are though, those people are already busy or unavailable, and while it never hurts to ask, the odds are heavily against you. Remember, your mentor doesn't have to be a household name to be a good oneâ€”anyone whose experience and wisdom you can learn from would make a great mentor.

More: http://facebook.com/startupfellowship.org

Connect: https://www.linkedin.com/in/theashutosh
